column1: Green peppers—Average retail price per pound and per cup equivalent, 2016

1It is assumed that the peppers are eaten raw. The USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR) reports that inedible seeds, core, and stem ends account for 18 percent of the vegetable's retail weight, indicating a preparation yield of 82 percent.

Source: Calculated by USDA, Economic Research Service, from 2016 IRI Infoscan data; the USDA National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference (SR), Release 26; and the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED) 2013-14 as well as the FPED's accompanying Methodology and User Guide.
